intro: Erigeron pyrifolius, commonly known as the Pyrethrum Leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silvery-green leaves and its daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers and is a member of the Asteraceae family. Erigeron pyrifolius is also noted for its potential medicinal uses and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
